ygData.subject: Re: I'm a mob magnet...
ygData.msgSnippet: run for the high bridge, jump in the water, run across 1st bridge, get out of BB for a little while hehe. ... From: Scott Murawski
ygData.messageBody:
run for the high bridge, jump in the water, run across 1st bridge, get
out of BB for a little while hehe.

-----Original Message-----
From: Scott Murawski [mailto:scott@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 01, 1999 7:43 AM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] I'm a mob magnet...


From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>

Hehe, this is quite the thread I started.

As the magnet I am, I was adventuring in BlackBurrow. Eventually I meet
up
with a few not so friendly gnolls who like to show me their pointy
claws.
Usually the result of a train someone else brought in. I then try to
cast
color flux and most of the time I can cast it even when attacked by a
few
of them.

During the time I try to cast color flux I don't actually fight back
1) I won't do any considerable damage and
2) fighting will add me deeper in their hate list

I think this is a good idea

The question is what to do after the color flux spell. If I don't
tashan
them first, I usually have a horrible rate of resists. I usually just
run
around and hopefully they switch targets and most of the time they do.
I
know this isn't a good solution.

The question is what do you guys do in a situation such as this?

Thanks

Azboklin the enchanter who can't wait till he's level 12 and gets new
nify
spells
